{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3575771,"name":"Chase Webster","username":"Cowette","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cowette/{size}/225237_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-01T01:35:57.866Z","cooked":"

As of right now, i’m not entirely sure we’ll have a CAD team next year. Yeah there’s people who want to learn, but idk if they’ll actually do it (experience from previous years says most likely not). I’d be really happy if they did, but we need to start preparing if they won’t. I just want to know how most teams get people on their design team to stay and learn.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2025-04-01T01:35:57.866Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":11,"reads":588,"readers_count":587,"score":187.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":497622,"topic_slug":"how-to-recruit-design-people","display_username":"Chase Webster","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":66306,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"7312 T3"},"post_url":"/t/how-to-recruit-design-people/497622/1","custom_user_title":"7312 T3","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3575779,"name":"Andrew","username":"Androo","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/androo/{size}/270986_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-01T01:47:59.156Z","cooked":"

As the main CAD Lead for my team, I have taught people on my team by putting them on specific projects such as working on the drive train or simple parts. During the summer, we plan to test our cadders by having them design a whole robot based around an old challenge or cadding out parts or mechanisms (Elevator, Arm, etc.). Obviously it is more biased and easier for our team as many mechanical members for us experience an Intro to Engineering class where they learn to CAD. However, for your team, if they are interested in learning, I would immerse them into a project or at least teach the main fundamentals of designing.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2025-04-01T01:47:59.156Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":5,"reads":567,"readers_count":566,"score":138.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":497622,"topic_slug":"how-to-recruit-design-people","display_username":"Andrew","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":65975,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"5013 Pit Crew and Design (I do not speak for my team, just my opinions)"},"post_url":"/t/how-to-recruit-design-people/497622/2","custom_user_title":"5013 Pit Crew and Design (I do not speak for my team, just my opinions)","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3575787,"name":"jedgar6","username":"jedgar6","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jedgar6/{size}/200602_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-01T01:56:25.072Z","cooked":"

No one’s born knowing how to design robots for frc. You make them, not find them. I highly suggest https://www.frcdesign.org/. We have started all our new designer/CADers on the learning course and we have seen major improvements. Next part of becoming a better designer is asking questions and look at every robot you can get your hands on.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2025-04-01T01:56:25.072Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":499,"readers_count":498,"score":184.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":497622,"topic_slug":"how-to-recruit-design-people","display_username":"jedgar6","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.frcdesign.org/","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"FRCDesign.org","clicks":68}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":5}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":33848,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"9410"},"post_url":"/t/how-to-recruit-design-people/497622/3","custom_user_title":"9410","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":4},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":5,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3575795,"name":"Braden Lynn","username":"BradenLynn3937","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bradenlynn3937/{size}/192207_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-01T02:05:45.402Z","cooked":"

100% Agree. I knew very little design knowledge until I went through FRCdesign this past fall. FUN Media’s Behind the Bumpers also really helped inspire me to design because you can see other people’s strategic designing up close and compare it to how it worked for them in their matches.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2025-04-01T02:05:45.402Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":427,"readers_count":426,"score":105.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":497622,"topic_slug":"how-to-recruit-design-people","display_username":"Braden Lynn","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":33848,"username":"jedgar6","name":"jedgar6","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jedgar6/{size}/200602_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":52449,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3937 Match Strategist"},"post_url":"/t/how-to-recruit-design-people/497622/4","custom_user_title":"3937 Match Strategist","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3576136,"name":"Chase Webster","username":"Cowette","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cowette/{size}/225237_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-01T04:33:13.657Z","cooked":"

That’s the issue, we’ve tried. I can’t count the amount of times i’ve sent that exact same link, or even video guides like Spectrum Cad tutorials or Robochargers Cad tutorials. They all say “ya i’ll work on it”, but they never end up doing it. I’m struggling to figure out how to get them to learn to design

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2025-04-01T04:33:13.657Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":357,"readers_count":356,"score":76.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":497622,"topic_slug":"how-to-recruit-design-people","display_username":"Chase Webster","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":33848,"username":"jedgar6","name":"jedgar6","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jedgar6/{size}/200602_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":66306,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"7312 T3"},"post_url":"/t/how-to-recruit-design-people/497622/5","custom_user_title":"7312 T3","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3576201,"name":"MH","username":"AntPoison","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/antpoison/{size}/239474_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-01T05:24:02.942Z","cooked":"

not an frcdesign.org plug totally not

CAD student myself, I believe it takes a certain type of person to do CAD, and even if you are that person, you have to be willing to grow in these:

  1. Hardworking and really really willing to fail
  2. Has the mental capacity to focus focus focus
  3. Can tolerate challenges and the intensive learning process

As far as easing the learning process, I believe frcdesign.org helps quite a bit with that, have you or your design lead go through it themselves so they can use it as an educator’s guide. Decent amount of hours you need to set aside.

It’s been a real challenge and learning experience for me because it’s something I didn’t know how to do beforehand. It took a lot of mentorship saying “hey this can be improved because ‘x’ and ‘y’” and also just reiteration and testing.

The best way to learn CAD nonetheless is real world settings. There are mini competitions called CAD-athons teams like 2485 Overclocked run that involve the release of a “game” and you race to CAD a robot based on that. It’s a very nice project. Immersing people straight in the experience starting from like a priority list, block CAD ideation, and then actually going out to make mechanisms. Have them take it from start to finish and encourage them heavily (reward system if you need to)

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2025-04-01T05:24:25.129Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":320,"readers_count":319,"score":79.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":497622,"topic_slug":"how-to-recruit-design-people","display_username":"MH","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"http://frcdesign.org","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"FRCDesign.org","clicks":13}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":64932,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6995 CAD&Prog, Strat/Scout Lead"},"post_url":"/t/how-to-recruit-design-people/497622/6","custom_user_title":"6995 CAD&Prog, Strat/Scout Lead","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3576206,"name":"MH","username":"AntPoison","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/antpoison/{size}/239474_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-01T05:27:12.136Z","cooked":"

Ah here’s the thing

(the anti-plug incoming)
I think that frcdesign. org is great, but the problem is definitely that it’s not real world interaction and teaching. You need to engage them in real life, make it fun. You really have to have a passion to do this, and you’re not going to get the passion for CAD if you aren’t actively doing a project in person with someone who can help you and make it slightly easier. There’s a big hump that people have to get over to WANT TO learn CAD and video tutorials/frcdesign .org will likely not be able to get you over that particular hump. Usually I’d recommend those tools once someone has really gotten themselves in the water of CAD a tiny little bit first. Make it fun, make it worth it, make it rewarding.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2025-04-01T05:27:12.136Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":270,"readers_count":269,"score":69.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":497622,"topic_slug":"how-to-recruit-design-people","display_username":"MH","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":66306,"username":"Cowette","name":"Chase Webster","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cowette/{size}/225237_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":64932,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6995 CAD&Prog, Strat/Scout Lead"},"post_url":"/t/how-to-recruit-design-people/497622/7","custom_user_title":"6995 CAD&Prog, Strat/Scout Lead","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3576852,"name":"philso","username":"philso","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/p/e68b1a/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-04-01T17:47:48.421Z","cooked":"

It would be good to play up the design role since it is a crucial part of your team’s success. It is mandatory if your team is using 3D printing and/or CNC routers in your manufacturing processes.

Learning how to do CAD design can be very helpful to many students when they enter the work force, even if they end up using a different CAD package.

Lastly, run the numbers. Not all who get trained will stick with it. The more you train, the more dedicated designers you will find.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2025-04-01T17:47:48.421Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":232,"readers_count":231,"score":46.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":497622,"topic_slug":"how-to-recruit-design-people","display_username":"philso","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":15467,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/how-to-recruit-design-people/497622/8","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3576894,"name":"John Hascall (he)","username":"john3928","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/john3928/{size}/143275_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-01T18:15:14.702Z","cooked":"

Retention may be the more important problem. Our process is:

  1. Mentor FLL teams. Side benefit, by 8th grade many want to be on our team.
  2. Summer “camp”. Every prospective member (including returning) must either attend or teach at least one summer camp.
  3. Fall semester projects. Picks up where camp left off to build skills. Make it something interesting.
  4. Build season. Pair new students with experienced students in “subsystem subteams” and make sure the new students are a meaningful part of their design.
  5. Comp season. Design students (along with wiring/programming students) make up pit crew (repairs etc), and pit reps (talking to judges).
  6. Goto Step 1

And, don’t let design (or wiring/programming) subteams turn into “boys clubs”. You are throwing away at least half of your talent. {does not apply to single gender teams, obviously} Our way: everyone is expected to choose 1 tech team and 1 non-tech team (eg awards, fundraising, outreach, media, etc} to contribute to.

This is obviously not the only way, but it works for us. YMMV.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2025-04-01T18:15:14.702Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":223,"readers_count":222,"score":69.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":497622,"topic_slug":"how-to-recruit-design-people","display_username":"John Hascall (he)","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":46267,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Opinions expressed are mine only"},"post_url":"/t/how-to-recruit-design-people/497622/9","custom_user_title":"Opinions expressed are mine only","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3576904,"name":"Chase Webster","username":"Cowette","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cowette/{size}/225237_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-01T18:20:31.499Z","cooked":"

For context, we’re a school team which just so happens to be the good ol’ football school of Texas. We’ve tried reaching out to the Elementary and Middle schools about doing a FLL or FTC program, and every teacher we ask just ghosts us. The school district doesn’t even care about trying to set stuff up. To add on to this, we also don’t have enough funding to do off season projects. This is the first year where we have enough materials to build something during off season, and that is only because we bought too much heavy box tubing for this year.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2025-04-01T18:21:33.189Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":201,"readers_count":200,"score":50.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":497622,"topic_slug":"how-to-recruit-design-people","display_username":"Chase Webster","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":46267,"username":"john3928","name":"John Hascall (he)","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/john3928/{size}/143275_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":66306,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"7312 T3"},"post_url":"/t/how-to-recruit-design-people/497622/10","custom_user_title":"7312 T3","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3576942,"name":"John Hascall (he)","username":"john3928","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/john3928/{size}/143275_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-01T18:37:29.736Z","cooked":"
Cowette:

To add on to this, we also don’t have enough funding to do off season projects

These aren’t necessarily projects that actually build something. One example is a CADathon. Another is pick an old game, design some mechanism, and then look at the best robots from that year and see if your thinking was similar.

Our local football team is “not outstanding”, so I’m afraid I don’t have any advice there.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2025-04-01T18:37:29.736Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":10,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":183,"readers_count":182,"score":41.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":497622,"topic_slug":"how-to-recruit-design-people","display_username":"John Hascall (he)","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":46267,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Opinions expressed are mine only"},"post_url":"/t/how-to-recruit-design-people/497622/11","custom_user_title":"Opinions expressed are mine only","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3577012,"name":"Isaac Proctor","username":"Isaac-The-Pro","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/isaac-the-pro/{size}/265401_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-01T19:11:50.448Z","cooked":"

What we did to train our new design members was to create a certification for design, so they would have an end goal. Our certification consisted of logging a certain number of hours in frcdesign and/or some other project, and then taking a test where they had to CAD a swerve drivetrain with a bellypan, electronics, etc… During the offseason, we had our new members work on CADing last year’s kitbot from scratch, and use frcdesign to learn how to do stuff. We had experienced members(myself and our design lead) in the room working on other stuff ready to help them out and answer questions. By the beginning of build season, we had four new design students with lots of experience CADing between CADing the kitbot, doing exercises in frcdesign, and making a drivetrain for the certification test.

","post_number":14,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2025-04-08T03:12:27.008Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":11,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":100,"readers_count":99,"score":20.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":497622,"topic_slug":"how-to-recruit-design-people","display_username":"Chase Webster","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":46267,"username":"john3928","name":"John Hascall (he)","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/john3928/{size}/143275_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":66306,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"7312 T3"},"post_url":"/t/how-to-recruit-design-people/497622/14","custom_user_title":"7312 T3","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3583393,"name":"Nick Aarestad","username":"cadandcookies","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cadandcookies/{size}/158154_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-08T03:44:39.082Z","cooked":"

Take a look at what causes people to bounce off of design.

Is it overwhelming pressure?
Is it a lack of the feeling of progress?
Does learning CAD feel unapproachable?
Is it a lack of guidance or teaching?
Is it genuinely a lack of interest?

These all have different solutions. You might have all or none of those problems.

For overwhelming pressure:

  • Descope the robot design to something appropriate for your design team and their skills
  • Provide additional mentor assistance if available

Lack of progress:

  • Understand where in their learning they hit this point-- is it that they aren’t making anything tangible? Is it that they’ve designed the same drivetrain a dozen times? Sometimes variety is needed, sometimes actually making something is needed. Depends a lot

CAD feels unapproachable:

  • Build up to more complex CAD work-- you can’t just expect a kid to draw the rest of the owl. It’s easy to forget all the microsteps that go into even the simplest CAD work-- how to dimension a rectangle, how to draw and constrain holes apprpriately, etc. Start small, grow bigger.
  • This can also be the “boys club” issue John mentioned above. Creating space where it is psychologically safe to develop this skill is important in resolving this. The exact approach varies on the specific students and the exact situation on your team.

Lack of guidance/teaching:

  • This can vary-- CAD is fundamentally creative. Pointing them to specific exercises or resources can help, but you still need to check in and review on them. Most students work well when given personal attention-- check in, talk a little about the process and what they’re struggling with. Make sure you are available to help them bust through road blocks-- sometimes 5 seconds with an experienced designer can unblock something a novice has been struggling with for an hour.

Genuine lack of interest:

  • Most kids like pretty/cool parts and robots. Drawing the line from “this is something cool” to “this requires CAD” to “I can do this” is what you’re trying to do in their mind. You don’t need everyone to bite, just enough.
  • Put CAD in the path to some other related goal. Yeah, you could just cut the tubes and build the swerve, but you need to make the CAD first. Ultimately if a student is motivated by something other than CAD for its own sake (which describes most) what CAD is is a tool that can be used to achieve an aim

That’s probably the reverse order of what you’re worried about, but I hope you find that useful. I’ve been teaching CAD and design for most of the last decade, and it is still a process I work to refine, since I am lucky enough to be able to worry about developing specific students. Different kids need different things at different times to be successful.

","post_number":16,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2025-04-08T05:10:55.599Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":71,"readers_count":70,"score":14.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":497622,"topic_slug":"how-to-recruit-design-people","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":61769,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Onshape enjoyer"},"post_url":"/t/how-to-recruit-design-people/497622/16","custom_user_title":"Onshape enjoyer","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3583491,"name":"Dan","username":"tekdemo","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tekdemo/{size}/138330_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-08T08:40:39.050Z","cooked":"

I’d check with your designers, and really cross-reference your students’ goals, and the team needs. You may not have a consistent path for each student to get your team rolling here.

I can’t exactly provide a “cad mentor” pov, but as a mentor, and as someone who often tries to skirt CAD in my own projects, I think I can spot the issue, which is some feelings I share myself.
In some cases, one might just prefer hands on prototype and iteration over buckling down over a computer. CAD is also a steep learning curve, which can really up the “busywork” factor when you could just go off and “build the robot” instead. In some cases, CAD might not seem like it’s beneficial to the bigger picture at all.

What I’ve found helps myself in these situations is being keenly aware of what the benefits of actually doing the CAD is. Things like access to 3D printed parts to streamline the build, being able to mock up a prototype in a sketch, or clearly communicate/validate a complex design all justify the legitimate amount of effort that goes into the magic rectangle.

From an organizational perspective, cost. Our CAD guys have to have a “functional proof of concept” before we’ll buy parts for their cool ideas. This moves it from “optional” to “a necessary step to get to play with the robot”.

In the same vein, our team also has had great luck moving away from a “CAD Team” to a “functions team that designs, cads, and builds superstructure”. This builds on the general desire students have to actually build things, while also ensuring designers get the valuable feedback on manufacturability and reliability.

That said, if your team’s overall CAD skillset is low, set restrained requirements and only do the cad that needs to be done. Consider sticking with simpler tools like KrayonCad, basic Inventor sketches, rough assemblies, and once you’ve hit the minimum metric, let the students have fun.

Isaac-The-Pro:

What we did to train our new design members was to create a certification for design, so they would have an end goal.

Do you have a place where you publish your certs + training plans? I was talking with your mentors about these, and honestly they looked like really solid ways to cover the basics, and ensure every student is prepped for the real competition season. Just all around fantastic training plans and goal setting, and totally fitting to shill in this thread.

I didn’t spot the CAD plans, but I definitely was planning to steal a few ideas on the programming side.

","post_number":18,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2025-04-08T08:49:08.727Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":12,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":61,"readers_count":60,"score":12.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":497622,"topic_slug":"how-to-recruit-design-people","display_username":"Dan","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":44763,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2811 Programming Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/how-to-recruit-design-people/497622/18","custom_user_title":"2811 Programming Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3584100,"name":"Ainesh Yarlagadda","username":"Ainesh","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ainesh/{size}/266351_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-08T18:50:21.949Z","cooked":"

This is a pretty large scale idea, but it works pretty well for my team.

My team in the fall hosts what we call the ‘rodeo’ (we are a Texas team). Basically, the mentors design a game for us to make a robot for, just like for build season, except naturally the game is less complicated than your typical FRC game and we get less time. Our team gets divided into 4 teams with each sub team represented in each, but since each of these smaller teams is small, each person learns a lot of the other skills. Including CAD. In fact, a marketing person did most of the CAD for my team and did it really well and learned a lot. With a little bit of tweaking, might be a good way to recruit some people into CAD?
